Title: One Last Fix
Text: Remy handed me an old key and pointed toward the garage where he once worked. It’s boarded up and mostly collapsed, but somewhere inside, there’s a tool he left behind—a wrench that meant a lot to him. He says I’ll know it when I see it. I hope the place hasn’t swallowed it completely.

Lore: §8A heavy, oil-stained tool with a smooth grip.
§8The initials §oR.D.§8 are carved faintly near the handle.
§7"It fixed more than cars—it held a life together."
display.Name: §7§lOld Remy's Wrench

CompleteText: There’s a weight to the wrench, more than just the metal. When I give it back to Remy, he holds it like it’s a piece of himself. His silence says more than thanks ever could. I don’t think this is just about cars anymore. He’s remembering the better times—one last fix before letting go.
